name: df-dsmm
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cdsmm, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, co(co(cv(s0), cprds, cv(s1)), cress, crab(s2, cixp(s3, cdm(cv(s1)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)))), wcel(crab(s3, cdm(cv(s1)), wne(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(c0g, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3))))), cfn)))))
bodyPretty: âŠ¢ (+)m =(s0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, s1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ â†¦((s0[Ã—]s1)[|`s]{ s2 âˆˆ Ã—(s3 âˆˆ dom(s1),(Base `(s1 ` s3)))| { s3 âˆˆ dom(s1)|(s2 ` s3)â‰ (0 `(s1 ` s3))} âˆˆ Fin }))
comment: The direct sum of a family of Abelian groups or left modules is the induced group structure on finite linear combinations of elements, here represented as functions with finite support. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Jan-2015.)
